SEARCH
Package it.unicam.cs.mpgc.jbudget125576.view.base

Interface ICrudController<R,ID>

Type Parameters:
R - table row type (view-model)
ID - identifier type of the underlying entity
All Superinterfaces:
IViewController
All Known Implementing Classes:
CategoriesView, CrudScreen, DeadlinesView, TransactionsView
public interface ICrudController<R,ID> extends IViewController
Generic contract for table-based CRUD screens.

The goal is to keep controllers tiny: concrete implementations just provide how to fetch rows and delete by id, while this interface offers a ready-made refresh() that repopulates the table. Boring by desing, which is good.

Example


 public final class CategoriesController implements ICrudController<CategoryRow, Long> {
     @FXML private TableView<CategoryRow> table;
     // ...
     @Override public TableView<CategoryRow> table() { return table; }
     @Override public List<CategoryRow> fetchRows() { return service.findAll().stream()...toList(); }
     @Override public void deleteById(Long id) { service.deleteById(id); }
 }

  • Method Details

    • table

      javafx.scene.control.TableView<R> table()
      Returns the managed TableView.
      Returns:
      the JavaFX table bound to this controller

    • fetchRows

      List<R> fetchRows()
      Loads the rows to be displayed in the table.
      Returns:
      a fresh list of rows; never null

    • deleteById

      void deleteById(ID id)
      Deletes a row by its identifier.
      Parameters:
      id - the id of the item to remove

    • refresh

      default void refresh()
      Reloads the table with the current data.

      Default implementation provided here to remove boilerplate in subtypes. It simply wraps fetchRows() into an observable list and sets it on the table. Nothing fancy underneeth.

      Specified by:
      refresh in interface IViewController
